main_definition: The rear part of something or someone, the direction opposite to front; a situation that reverses previous progress.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To return to a previous state or position.
meanings_and_examples.example: After losing his job, he decided to backtrack and find another opportunity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The rear part of the body from the shoulders to the hips.
meanings_and_examples.example: She gently massaged her sore back after a long day at work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To reconsider or change one's mind about an action, decision, or belief.
meanings_and_examples.example: I thought I wanted to go on the trip, but now I've decided to back out of it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The reverse direction from which something comes; the opposite side of a line, plane, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: He turned around and went back down the street towards his house.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To support or assist someone in achieving their goals.
meanings_and_examples.example: She was always there to back me up when I faced challenges at work.
